intro: Stillingia biglandulosa, commonly known as the biglandular stillingia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and distinctive, branched stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
